page.title: 16FARM SURVEYS AT NANTGLYN 1
page.content: Sheep farming is the main occupation.The farm studied was on steep land its valley sides rising from the flat land near the River Ystrad at 150m.to the highest land at 220m.Out of 55h.improved pasture filled 30 with 10h.of ley pasture for hay and silage.The steep slopes had deciduous wood with rough pasture where sheep could still graze.There was a small new amenity woodland.No arable land, although the previous owner had good barley crops. There were 350 ewes, mostly Welsh half breeds or Beulah. The sheep were out all year, lowland wintering was not needed, the farm did not often get snow bound.Sheep sometimes came in for lambing.In summer 60 young dairy cows were fed on the better pasture. The land was classed as marginal so the EEC sheep subsidy was recieved.
